cheatsheet.title: Generate a JAX-WS SEI and a skeleton implementation bean from a WSDL document using Apache CXF

intro.description:
This cheat sheet will demonstrate how to use the Web Services wizard to generate a JAX-WS Service Endpoint Interface and a skeleton implementation bean from a WSDL document using the Apache CXF runtime.
If you need help at any step, click the help button in the top right corner (?).

item.title: Create or import a WSDL document
item.description: Create or import a WSDL file into the Web Content folder of the Web project. The WSDL document must have a valid service element.

item.title: Generate a JAX-WS SEI and a skeleton implementation bean from the WSDL document
item.description: To generate a JAX-WS SEI and a skeleton implementation bean from a WSDL document perform the following steps:

subitem.label: Select "File -> New -> Other..." from the main menu, expand the "Web Services" category and select "Web Service". Click "OK" to launch the Web Services wizard or select the "Click to perform" button to do this automatically.
Select "Top down Java bean Web Service" as the "Web service type".
Browse to select the Service definition.
Verify that "Apache CXF 2.x" is selected as the Web service runtime.
Move the service slider to the "Develop service" stage.
Accept all other default values on this page and click "Next >".
On the Apache CXF WSDL to Java page accept the defaults and click "Next >".
Select "Generate Implementation" on the WSDL to Java preference override page and click "Finish".
